Body: I was wondering if there was way to ping google.com (or any other stable site) and record my GPS location. It would then append the result of the ping, GPS position, and the time to a file on my phone. It would run every 10 seconds or so. Basically, I just want to get a view of my cellphone's Internet connection throughout the day and at different times. After a full day of this app running, I could then look at the generated file and figure out all sorts of interesting analytics for my phone.If there is no such app, is there any quick script or something that would do this?
Title: Method to monitor data connection based on location

history.Text: I was wondering if there was such a thing as a app that would ping google.com (or any other stable site) and record my gps location. It would then append the result of the ping, gps position, and time to a file on my phone. Run every 10 seconds or so. Basically, I just want to get a view of my cellphones internet connection throughout the day and at different times. After a full day of this app running, I could then look at the generated file and figure out all sorts of interesting analytics for my phone.If there is no such app, is there any quick script or something that would do this?
